passages.text: THIS MORNING AT 8:30AM I'll host a MRVL results download with Harlan Sur. Register here.

And TUESDAY AT 9AM ETSamik Chatterjee is hosting a call with highly- regarded Legal Professor Timothy Meyer to discuss the current tariff landscape, Section 232 investigations, and implications for the global technology sector. You can register here.

- OnThursday, Sept 4, the team hosts our Rising Tech Leaders Forum in NYC, at our 383 Madison HQ. Attendees: AAOI(CFO), AXON (IR), CALX (CEO), DELL (CFO), FLEX(CFO), KEYS (CEO), LITE (CFO), MSI (IR), SANM (CFO) & SMTC (CEO). Register here.- A reminder that we're hosting ADI, ARM, AVGO, Emerson Electric, TXN and many others at our US All-Stars Conference in London Sept 16-17. I'll also be in London for the event and marketing around it, so let me know if you want to meet up!- Our China team is hosting a pre-earnings China Tech Channel Check Tour around Shanghai, visiting nearly 20 domestic Chinese tech companies, Sept 17-19. Contact me for details.- We host our flagship annual Global Tech, Media & Telecom Conference in HK on Nov 17-18, expected to bring together over 150 tech leaders from around the world. Let me know if you want details, or to sign up!- DELL: F2Q Earnings Recap – AI Revenue Strength Hits Margins; Execution is the 2H Watchpoint- MRVL: In-Line Results with some Surprises & Confusion; but Visibility to multi-gen AI programs remains (below)

DELL: F2Q Earnings Recap – AI Revenue Strength Hits Margins; Execution is the 2H Watchpoint. Here DELL executed on strong AI server delivery (\$8.2b vs. JPM \\(7.2b), and announced robust incremental orders (\)5.6b) to support a strong backlog. The team raised its revenue outlook by over 3% at the midpoint (driven by AI Server strength) and earnings outlook by about half that amount. Margins are being impacted by AI server supply chain inefficiencies (including expedite costs) further pressuring ISG margins beyond the already expected pressure from competitive AI server deals (to win business with concentrated customers). This all takes conversations back to concerns about the aggressive bids to win concentrated customers, and lumpiness in demand. On the positive side, a big move in the FY AI server orders outlook from \(15b+\) to \(20b\) at lease underscores DELL's competitiveness. That offsets some incremental weakness in traditional infrastructure demand, where expectations for Storage and traditional Server demand have deteriorated (in addition to a modest shortfall in CSG)... these to a

tune of c. - \$1b. More importantly, Dell is confident in its supply chain capabilities, and adds optimism that Storage seasonality sets them up to report better margins (average of \(- 10\%\) implied in 2H v. \(7.4\%\) in 1H) and profits in the 2H of the fiscal year \((- 35\%)\) increase H/H). The margin improvement trajectory outlined by the company for the remainder of the year will be a key watchpoint for investors in the near term - as will the Analyst Meeting in October, where the company is expected to provide updated medium- term targets. Samik remains Overweight- rated given strong positioning in AI and traditional infrastructure, in addition to cost discipline and buybacks.

MRVL: In- Line Results with some Surprises & Confusion; but Visibility to multi- gen AI programs remains. Here I had no fun on the MRVL earnings call last night, but I had a blast writing my MRVL earnings takeaways note, which was mainly a collection of feedback from you investors. Please have a look. Meanwhile, after his callback Harlan Sur shared his own recap. MRVL printed an in- line Jul- Q with upside in consumer demand offsetting a little weakness in Data Center, Carrier Infrastructure, and Enterprise Networking; and the team guides to an in- line Oct- Q (if you adjust for divestiture of its auto ethernet business). The core business guide is largely in- line, though end- market mix differs from expectations. The team expects only flatish Data Center revenues, offset by a strong acceleration in Carrier Infrastructure & Enterprise Networking (+30%QoQ). These are slightly weaker results than we expected - above all as strong global AI spending trends are not being seen at MRVL. Indeed, the team implicitly guides a double- digit sequential drop in custom ASIC (due to "lumpiness") before that important business re- accelerates in the Jan- Q. They still see a stronger 2H for custom ASIC, but offered no updates on AMZN Trainium 3/4 nor Microsoft MAIA 3nm/2nm programs (citing non- disclosure/confidentiality agreements). Harlan's checks indicate that both the 3nm Trainium and 3nm Maia programs are on track for production in CY26. Longer- term, the team continues to expand its AI ASIC design win pipeline and has secured additional sockets (on top of the 18 sockets disclosed at the analyst day). AI networking demand remains strong, driven by 800G PAM4 DSP product; demand for the 1.6T PAM4 DSP is also beginning to ramp up. Harlan underscores that the team's AI- related programs and products (optical/ASICs) are on track to drive a strong C25 (+2x YoY) and C26. Harlan takes down his F27 earnings and also moves from a 35x to a 33x target multiple taking TP down \(7.7\%\) to \$120
Use the links below to jump straight to each section:
TMT Headlines Key Global Research J.P. Morgan TMT Events J.P. Morgan TMT Cbntacts

- Trump Leans on National Security to Justify Next Wave of Tariffs: Expanded steel and aluminum tariffs are just the start; new devices seen as likely for semiconductors, heavy trucks, commercial aircraft and more -WSJ.com- China reportedly plans to triple AI chip output by 2026, with 3 fabs for Huawei - Digitimes(quoting FT)- Lutnick to TSMC: no free ride on Biden's US\$6.5B chip grant. Lutnick argued that the Biden administration's US\$6.5 billion federal subsidy to TSMC was "absurd," stressing that under the Trump administration, the US intends to claw back the grant - Digitimes- TSMC's N3P and CoWoS-L at the helm as NVIDIA's Rubin series could be packaged as early as the end of the year. Taiwanese equipment manufacturers are flooded with orders - Chinatimes

VMware remains cautious on expanding support for Arm architecture despite growing market interest - Digitimes South Korean media points to TSMC as main cause of Samsung's AP procurement cost surge. While increasing the use of its own Exynos chips could potentially reduce procurement expenses, Samsung still finds it challenging to fully replace Qualcomm's products due to performance and market competitiveness considerations - Digitimes Microsoft AI launches its first in-house models - The Verge

- APAC Energy Transition - Tightness and Tribulations: Ten Fresh Takes on Clean Energy Supply. here- Marvell Technology Inc - Core Business In-Line On Strong Cyclical Trends; Strong Optical Offset By Lumpiness In Custom AI ASICs; We Believe Key 3nm Custom AI ASIC XPU Programs Remain On Track; Reit OW. here- Dell Technologies - F2Q26 Review: AI Revenue and Margin Execution Diverges; Guided Margin Improvement in 2H Will Shift Focus to Near-Term Execution. here- PCs and Servers - Read-through from Dell/HPQ Jul-25 earnings. here- Universal Scientific Industrial (Shanghai) - A - Model Update. here- Transision Holdings - A - Sequential revenue/GPM growth in 2Q25, but earnings missed due to elevated R&D. here- J.P. Morgan Taiwan FTM 29 Aug 25 - Asia ex-Japan Equity Strategy; Asian Tech; Taiwan PCB and CCL; Hua Nan FHC; Silergy Corp and More. here- ASE Technology Holding Co Ltd - Key Takeaways from J.P. Morgan Asia Tech Tour. here- Alchip Technologies - Key takeaways from J.P. Morgan's Asia Tech Tour. here- Taiwan PCB and CCL - Potentially taking a breather, but LT tightness remains intact. here- Inari Amertron Berhad - Flagship launch to drive seasonal pickup; limited content growth. here- Silergy Corp - Lower 2025 growth, but strong 2026 outlook with more meaningful automotive content growth; OW. here
TMT Trading: Stuart Humphrey - US TMT (Software, Semi's, Hardware, Payments) Michael Krueger - US TMT Derivatives Richard Arnopp - EU TMT Mike Kenneally - EU TMT Derivatives
